com.google.appinventor.client.widgets.dnd
Interface DropTarget

All Known Implementing Classes:
MockCanvas, MockContainer, MockForm, MockHorizontalArrangement, MockTableArrangement, MockVerticalArrangement, SimpleNonVisibleComponentsPanel, SimpleVisibleComponentsPanel
public interface DropTarget

Interface for GWT components that are willing to accept drag sources dropped on them.

Method Summary
 Widget getDropTargetWidget()
          Returns the GWT component associated with this DropTarget.
 void onDragContinue(DragSource source, int x, int y)
          Invoked while an accepted drag source is being dragged over this target's widget.
 boolean onDragEnter(DragSource source, int x, int y)
          Invoked when a drag source that is currently being dragged enters the bounds of this target's widget.
 void onDragLeave(DragSource source)
          Invoked while an accepted drag source has been dragged outside the bounds of this target's widget.
 void onDrop(DragSource source, int x, int y, int offsetX, int offsetY)
          Invoked when the user drops an accepted drag source on this target's widget.
 

Method Detail

getDropTargetWidget

Widget getDropTargetWidget()
Returns the GWT component associated with this DropTarget. The location of this widget is used to determine the bounds of the drop region.

This method may be called frequently.

Returns:
widget

onDragEnter

boolean onDragEnter(DragSource source,
                    int x,
                    int y)
Invoked when a drag source that is currently being dragged enters the bounds of this target's widget.

Returns true if the drag source is accepted, false otherwise.

If this method accepts that drag, it is guaranteed that onDragContinue(DragSource, int, int) will be invoked immediately afterwards with the same x and y arguments.

Parameters:
source - the drag source that is hovering over this drop target's widget
x - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
y - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
Returns:
true if the source is accepted, false otherwise

onDragContinue

void onDragContinue(DragSource source,
                    int x,
                    int y)
Invoked while an accepted drag source is being dragged over this target's widget.

It is guaranteed that:

  1. this method will be invoked immediately after an invocation of onDragEnter(DragSource, int, int) that accepts its drag source
  2. this method will be invoked immediately before an invocation of onDrop(DragSource, int, int, int, int)

Parameters:
source - the accepted drag source that is hovering over this drop target's widget
x - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
y - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget

onDragLeave

void onDragLeave(DragSource source)
Invoked while an accepted drag source has been dragged outside the bounds of this target's widget.

Parameters:
source - the accepted drag source that is hovering over this drop target's widget

onDrop

void onDrop(DragSource source,
            int x,
            int y,
            int offsetX,
            int offsetY)
Invoked when the user drops an accepted drag source on this target's widget.

It is guaranteed that onDragContinue(DragSource, int, int) will have been invoked immediately beforehand with the same x and y arguments.

Parameters:
source - the accepted drag source that has been dropped on this drop target's widget
x - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
y - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
offsetX - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of the drag-widget
offsetY - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of the drag-widget
